metadata.title: RH850/F1x: How can I code for an interrupt in F1K, for example, if a rising edge is detected, a GPIO must be set high?

sections.content:
Question:
How can I code for an interrupt in F1K, for example, if a rising edge is detected, a GPIO must be set high?
Answer:
There is a tool called Applilet4.
The Applilet4 is a software tool for automatically generating control programs (device driver programs) for peripheral modules (timers, UART, A/D, etc.) in accordance with user settings via a GUI.
You can download it - as well as the manual and release notes - from the web page from Renesas (you will find it under “Software Tools”: https://www.renesas.com/eu/en/products/microcontrollers-microprocessors/rh850/rh850f1x/rh850f1k.html#designsupport
Suitable Products
RH850/F1x
